title: Rahul gets 34% marks in an exam and fails by 90 marks. Rishi gets 36% marks and he also fails by 72 marks. What is the minimum percentage of marks a student should gain to pass the exam? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for A2A The answer is - 44% Explanation - The 2% difference accounts for 18 marks difference. Thus, 1% will be equal to 9 marks By above logic, if we take Rahul’s case, he will need 90 marks to pass which will be equal to 10%. So add those 10% to his current 34% which will give you 44%. Hence the answer. Alternatively, you may even calculate minimum pass % by taking Rishu’s case. He needs 72 marks or 8% (72÷9) more to pass. So 36% +8% = 44%. Hope the explanation helps. :)
